title: Cold Weather Cattle Management Webinar - March 12 2019

tasks.task: Assessing Cow and Bull Condition and Managing Bulls in Winter
subtasks: Evaluate body condition scoring (BCS) using rib visibility, spine visibility, and shape between hooks and pin bones
Understand the impact of BCS on energy expenditure and calf productivity
Recognize the need to maintain bulls' BCS during breeding season (4-7)
Provide windbreaks and bedding for scrotal protection in cold weather
Conduct breeding soundness exams 1 month before breeding

tasks.task: Managing Chilled Calves and Cold Stress
subtasks: Identify calves in cold stress (behavioral signs, hypothermia)
Provide immediate warmth using rectal temperature as a guide; colostrum supplementation for energy and immunity
Utilize barns, windbreaks, and adequate bedding for calf protection
Ensure sufficient colostrum for thermoneutral zone requirements (2-3L for newborn)

tasks.task: Stretching Hay Supply and Supplementing Rations
subtasks: Assess energy needs based on temperature and windchill
Adjust hay feeding rates (e.g., 35-40 lbs in extreme cold)
Consider feeding grains (e.g., corn, distillers grains) to balance energy and protein
Evaluate co-products (wheat middlings, distillers grains) for supplementation
Plan pasture turnout considering plant growth stages and environmental conditions
Prepare for pasture turnout with grazing readiness based on growth stages
Address potential delays and stress on pastures from winter conditions
Plan ahead for nutrient-rich pastures if hay supplies are scarce
